page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: THIS IS A PREDOMINATELY RURAL AREA OF SMALL FARMS AT THE NORTH OF THE VALE OF CLWYD.THE LARGEST URBAN AREA IN THE BLOCK IS THE SMALL CITY OF ST.ASAPH WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 3200.THE CITY HAS AN ATTRACTIVE CATHEDERAL WHICH IS REPUTED TO BE THE SMALLEST IN BRITAIN.A WEEKLY LIVESTOCK MARKET IS HELD EVERY THURSDAY IN THE CITY WHICH ATTRACTS FARMERS FROM ALL PARTS OF NORTH WALES. THERE ARE VERY FEW FACTORIES WITHIN THE BLOCK BUT THE TWO LARGEST ARE PILKINGTONS,THE GLASS MAKERS,ANE EGA TUBE,THE MAKERS OF FIBRE OPTICS.GEOGRAPHICALLY THE AREA RISES FROM FIFTEEN METERS ABOVE SEA LEVEL AT ITS NORTHERN END TO HIGH POINT OF A 164 METERS AT CEFN MEIRIADOG.
